project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using Service Desk 2.5.9 with an Agent based license the application response time is severely impacted when there are more than 10k Agents and during LDAP syncs.  The worst affected views are from the REST APIs, {{rest/api/2/users}} and {{rest/api/2/groups}}.

After upgrade, 99th percentile of all request times increased to 30 seconds when Active Directory user synchronization is running or when our jira-ilists group (17k users) is added to Service Desk Agent role. Otherwise, 99th% is ~2-5 sec. Monitoring 99th percentile execution time of all requests has had strong correlation with user complaints about performance in the past.

We have unlimited licenses for everything.  When we upgraded to JIRA 6.4 and JIRA Service Desk 2.5.9 we were issued an Agent-base license (unlimited Agents).  Previously all jira-users could access SD features we wanted without extensive intervention from JIRA admins.  Our users mainly want the simplified issue creation and SLAs.

With an Agent based license, only Agents that are members of the Service Desk Team role for a project can be assigned issues and this is a big obstacle for us.  To work around it we added the equivalent of our jira-users group to the Service Desk Agent group (jira-ilists, approx 17k users).  This triggered the performance problems.


h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.12, Service Desk 2.5.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.4.12 with Service Desk 2.5.9
# Generate 400 projects, each with a Service Desk.
# Add a group with 10k members to the Service Desk Agent group.

h3. Expected Results
* Requests for {{rest/api/2/users}} and {{rest/api/2/groups}} should perform well during Active Directory sync and when using an Agent based license.

h3. Actual Results
* Requests for {{rest/api/2/users}} and {{rest/api/2/groups}} are dramatically slower when there are thousands of Agents with an Agent based license.


h3. Notes

Extensive logs and data are available on the support case, [PS-3211|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/PS-3211].  This is only accessible by Atlassians.

h3. Workaround

* Only add users that require Agent features to the Service Desk Agents group rather than all users.
fields.summary: JIRA performance is degraded when using an Agent based license with lots of Agents

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
When trying to use the Date Picker feature for the Date Field on *Holidays* section, no popup will come out.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Navigate to a Service Desk Project Administration Page.
# Click on SLA, then Calendars.
# Edit the *Sample 9-5 Calendar*
# Scroll to Holiday.
# Click on the Calendar Icon.

h3. Expected Result:
A pop-up which the user could choose calendar will appear.

h3. Actual Result:
It does nothing.

In Console log , showed :-
 !Screen Shot 2016-02-22 at 5.40.35 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround:
Manually enter date with format *dd/MMM/yy* 
* Example: 01/JAN/16

h3. Notes:
* We could input the date manually on the field, but the error shown if the wrong date format is not really informative unlike in JIRA side.
** JIRA Service Desk Holiday Date Picker.
{code} Invalid format: "12/12/2016" is malformed at "12/2016" {code}
** JIRA
{code} You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy", eg. "29/Jan/16" {code}
fields.summary: SLA Calendar Holiday Date Picker does not work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3353].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Diagnosis:
In Service Desk, we could configure multiple SLA on one project and there is a chance that the issue will met every SLA conditions. This will make the issue show all SLA in the JIRA Issue details view regardless of the status of the SLA, hence if there is 9 SLA on the ticket and only 2 that is actually still running, the rest of the SLA will still shown when it should be less important compare to the running SLA.

h3. Suggested Feature:
Hence, it will be great if we have a feature to hide any SLA that is currently not running it would be great. We could group the SLA together when it is Paused or Stopped in one section that could be expanded/collapse by the user. This will make the SLA details more neat.
fields.summary: Option to Hide Paused/Stopped SLA

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3347].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition 
Out of office emails can be a big issue for an organization which is growing in number of users. Therefore receiving such emails for various tickets can waste time off ServiceDesk agent.  

h3. Suggested Solution
By filtering out "out of office" emails we can reduce this traffic and prevent them from adding comment to the tickets.

This plugin [Enterprise Mail Handler for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.javahollic.jira.jemh-ui/cloud/overview] or other sort of plugins can be used as workaround. 
(!) Please contact the plugin's vendor in order to make sure about functionality as Atlassian does not support third party plugins.
fields.summary: Ability To Filter Out of Office Auto Emails

The info on being notified during status transitions should not be there.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
When Editing an issue through the Edit issue screen and the issue details will move it out to another "SLA Goal" condition, the SLA will somehow missing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a new SLA called "Waiting for Support"
# Set the condition to start at "Waiting for Support", pause in "Waiting for Customer" and stop at "Entered Status:Resolved"
# Set the Goal for "All Remaining Issue" to 1 hour.
# Save the SLA and create new issue.
# Make sure that both SLA is appearing.
# Click Edit and change the "Priority = Critical" (Time to Resolution default Goal will be Priority = Blocker)
# Apply the changes.

h3. Expected Result:
"Time to Resolution" SLA will be missing as the "All Remaining Issue" does not have target and "Waiting for Support" still running.

h3. Actual Result:
Both SLA missing from the view issue detail.

h3. Workaround:
Go to the project service desk admin page (_Service Desk > Select Project_) and move to SLA tab to update the SLA.
fields.summary: SLA will be missing when Editing an issue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3335].
  {panel}

If you have a comment restriction for rules like "Transition on comment" and a "Alert user", the "Ready For Support" and "Respond to Customer" buttons won't trigger the Alert.


*Steps tro Reproduce*
{quote}
1. Create a new user and add it to a GroupX, for example;

2. Create the first Automation Rule:
*Transition on comment*
*When* _Issue Commented_ *if* _Status = "Waiting for Support" and "Customer Request Type" is not empty_ *and* _comment is public_ *and* _user is not a customer_ *then* _Transition to Respond to Customer_
*Else if* _Status = "Waiting for Customer" and "Customer Request Type" is not empty_ *and* _comment is public_ *and* _user is a customer_ *then* _Transition to Ready for Support_

3. Create the second *custom* Automation Rule:
*When* _Issue Commented_ *if* _status in ("Waiting for Support", "Waiting for Customer")_ *and* _reporter in (membersOf(GroupX))_ *and* _comment is internal_ *Then* _Alert Users xx_

4. Create a ticket through customer portal with the user recently created.
5. Use an Agent to Respond to customer with an internal comment. 
{quote}

*Expected behaviour*
The issue is transitioned, an internal comment is posted and an Alert will be triggered.

*Current Behaviour*
The issue is transitioned with an internal comment, but with no Alert triggered.

JIRA Service Desk v3.1.0-OD-12-001-D20160118T065214
fields.summary: Transition button doesn't comment on ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3333].
  {panel}

My organisation is currently in the process of migrating to JIRA Service Desk from our existing supplier, but one of the features that I am unable to identify within JIRA SD is the function to set the call status to automatically change on a given time/date.  For example, a request is logged but doesn't need to start until two weeks later, therefore we change the call status to 'On-Hold', but then specify the time and date when we would like the call status to automatically change to 'Open'.

This is an extremely important feature for us and would require this if we are to complete our migration.  Could I request that this feature is added at your earliest possible convenience please.  One possible way that I see this working in JIRA would be to add an Auto Status Change feature within a Workflow Transition.  However, I'm still fairly new to this so you may be able to advise of another solution.

I look forward to hearing from you.

Many thanks
Nathan
fields.summary: URGENT - Auto Status Change Functionality Required

fields.description:
h4. Problem
JIRA Service Desk bundles a plugin called {{JIRA Timed Promises Plugin}}. This runs a periodical cleanup of the past timed promise events, for which a very ineffective query is being used (see below).

The query execution plan is fine on MySQL 5.6.x, however on MySQL 5.5.x and below the query runs very ineffective, running for several hours (in cases reportedly over 20 hours).

h4. Additional details
The query (with the timestamp varying of course):
{code:sql}
delete from `ao_f1b27b_key_comp_history` where `ao_f1b27b_key_comp_history`.`id` in (select `component_to_delete`.`id` from (select `ao_f1b27b_key_comp_history`.`id` from `ao_f1b27b_promise_history` `promise_history` left join `ao_f1b27b_key_comp_history` `ao_f1b27b_key_comp_history` on `promise_history`.`id` = `ao_f1b27b_key_comp_history`.`timed_promise_id` where `promise_history`.`key_hash` in (select `history_record`.`timed_promise_history_key_hash` from `ao_f1b27b_history_record` `history_record` group by `history_record`.`timed_promise_history_key_hash` having max(`history_record`.`target_time_millis`) < 1444977171288)) as `component_to_delete`);{code}

On MySQL 5.6.x the query finishes under a second and the execution looks like this:
{code:sql}
mysql> explain select * from `AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMP_HISTORY` where `AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMP_HISTORY`.`ID` in (select `COMPONENT_TO_DELETE`.`ID` from (select `AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMP_HISTORY`.`ID` from `AO_F1B27B_PROMISE_HISTORY` `PROMISE_HISTORY` left join `AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMP_HISTORY` `AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMP_HISTORY` on `PROMISE_HISTORY`.`ID` = `AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMP_HISTORY`.`TIMED_PROMISE_ID` where `PROMISE_HISTORY`.`KEY_HASH` in (select `HISTORY_RECORD`.`TIMED_PROMISE_HISTORY_KEY_HASH` from `AO_F1B27B_HISTORY_RECORD` `HISTORY_RECORD` group by `HISTORY_RECORD`.`TIMED_PROMISE_HISTORY_KEY_HASH` having max(`HISTORY_RECORD`.`TARGET_TIME_MILLIS`) < 1444977171288)) as `COMPONENT_TO_DELETE`);
+----+--------------+----------------------------+--------+------------------------------+-------------------------------+---------+--------------------------------------+-------+---------------------------------+
| id | select_type  | table                      | type   | possible_keys                | key                           | key_len | ref                                  | rows  | Extra                           |
+----+--------------+----------------------------+--------+------------------------------+-------------------------------+---------+--------------------------------------+-------+---------------------------------+
|  1 | PRIMARY      | AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMP_HISTORY | ALL    | PRIMARY                      | NULL                          | NULL    | NULL                                 |  8164 | Using where                     |
|  1 | PRIMARY      | <subquery2>                | eq_ref | <auto_key>                   | <auto_key>                    | 5       | ps3165.AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMP_HISTORY.ID |     1 | NULL                            |
|  2 | MATERIALIZED | <derived3>                 | ALL    | NULL                         | NULL                          | NULL    | NULL                                 |  8232 | NULL                            |
|  3 | DERIVED      | PROMISE_HISTORY            | index  | NULL                         | U_AO_F1B27B_PROMISE1620912431 | 767     | NULL                                 |  8232 | Using where; Using index        |
|  3 | DERIVED      | AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMP_HISTORY | ref    | index_ao_f1b27b_key828117107 | index_ao_f1b27b_key828117107  | 4       | ps3165.PROMISE_HISTORY.ID            |     1 | Using index                     |
|  4 | SUBQUERY     | HISTORY_RECORD             | ALL    | NULL                         | NULL                          | NULL    | NULL                                 | 82249 | Using temporary; Using filesort |
+----+--------------+----------------------------+--------+------------------------------+-------------------------------+---------+--------------------------------------+-------+---------------------------------+
6 rows in set (0,00 sec)
{code}

h4. Workaround
- Update to MySQL 5.6.x.
fields.summary: Timed Promises history cleanup slow on MySQL ≤ 5.5

h3. Problem Definition

It is not clear that the JIRA User permission is required for all Service Desk roles except for Customers.  For customers that switch to agent based pricing with pre-existing custom permission schemes it is difficult to know what needs to be done to get everything working correctly.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a note at [Mandatory permissions by project roles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk025/using-custom-permission-schemes-754977475.html#Usingcustompermissionschemes-Mandatorypermissionsbyprojectroles]:

Members of these project roles must have the "JIRA User" [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/managing-global-permissions-185729559.html] with the exception of "Service Desk Customers".
fields.summary: Clarify that JIRA User global permission is required for all non-Customer users.

h3. Problem Definition
As a Service Desk Agent, I would like to have the ability to export any queue from the SD view, instead of copying the queue query to Issue Navigator.

Include an option to Export Service Desk Queues to CSV or Excel (HTML) to be used in reporting
 
h3. Workaround 
Copy the JQL Query used in the Service Desk Queue into the Issue Navigator Search and use the export options there

  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/JIRA+Service+Desk+permissions

Update the documentation to reflect that normal JIRA Project Permissions are not honored in the same way with Service Desk Projects as they are in typical JIRA Projects. This is reflected in these two Service Desk Feature Requests:

[JSD-861: Jira Service Desk should not restrict Project actions| https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-861]
[JSD-931: Allow collaborators to modify issues dependent on their permissions | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-931]

The documentation does state:
_Each type of user displayed on the People tab of your service desk matches a JIRA project role, and the project permissions for each type of user are assigned to the JIRA project roles in the permission scheme_

However, it should be clear that just because a certain permission is granted in the Project's Permission Scheme, it doesn't mean that the permission is granted in the Service Desk Project according to the Service Desk Project Roles, and that the Service Desk Project Permission Scheme does not take precedence.
fields.summary: Update Service Desk Documentation to Reflect that Project Permissions are Not As Relevant

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's possible to allow all logged in SD customers to access the Knowledge Base in Confluence that's assigned to a given Service Desk. However, this also gives access to all Confluence users. If a user wants only SD customers to access but not Confluence users, it is not possible.

I tried locking out all Confluence users in page restrictions, but you cannot specify "cannot view/edit" only "can". Also cannot specify in Space Permissions who cannot view, only can.

No known workaround

h3. Summary
Username rename will break the jql query used to retrieve an agent's issues in progress on the Servicedesk Agent's page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the username of an agent that has been assigned tickets in Service Desk
# Navigate to the Service Desk > People > Agents
# Click on the bar under "Issues in progress" for the renamed agent

h3. Expected Results
* The link should take you to the issue navigator where the list of unresolved issues assigned to the agent is displayed

h3. Actual Results
* Your're taking to the Issue Navigator, however, jql reports the following error:
{code}The value '$old-username' does not exist for the field 'assignee'.{code}
_note that $old-username would be the original username or user key of the renamed user_ 
h3. Notes
* The problem is occurring because the jql query is still referring to the old username, which is no longer being recognized as a user in JIRA, as the name has been changed.
* Issue is not reproducible in Service Desk 3.0.9, seems to be only an issue with JIRA Service Desk 2.5.x and JIRA 6.x
fields.summary: Renaming agent username breaks Agent's issues in progress jql query

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if a JIRA Service Desk project has *Anyone* added to the *Browse Projects* permission, this allows access to browse the project via the JIRA application, however not through the Customer Portal. fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3296].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Update as of 2 February 2016|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
This issue was caused by Service Desk switching to preferring the html part of a mail message, over text, which was the previous default. The existing Html To Text converter produces a body that will cite links at the bottom.

An update has been made to the Service Desk Mail Handler, so that it will instead convert the HTML contained in an email into wiki markup.

This will work best in multipart mime messages that contain both a text and html part. Most modern clients will send multipart messages by default.

The change will be included in JSD 3.2.0-OD-02 but will not function immediately, as it also requires a change to JIRA that should be released in the next 2-3 weeks
{panel}


h3. Summary
When an e-mail request is sent in to the JIRA Service Desk project's mail handler, the mail handler parses the content of the e-mail. Any URL, Phone Number, or E-mail address within the body of the e-mail gets appended with a number in the front, and then referenced at the bottom of the ticket description. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk v3.1.0-OD-10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable Email Requests on a JIRA Service Desk project
# Send in an e-mail to the JSD mail handler that contains an E-mail address, URL, and Phone number in the body
# Observe the change in format when the mail handler creates the ticket

h3. Expected Results
Issue Description should be formatted in the same format as when it was sent in.

h3. Actual Results
Issue is converted to a different format, causing issues with accessing the links in some cases.
 
h3. Notes
- In some cases, the issue is only reproducible with one of the following: URL, E-mail address, Phone number.
- Other formatting/styling issues such as omitted line breaks are symptoms of this bug

h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler is appending numbers to URLs, Email Addresses, and Phone Numbers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3295].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 31st May 2018}
*Thank you for your feedback*

We appreciate your time in taking the survey. The survey is now closed. We will be getting in touch with some of you shall there be any progress on this feature request.

Jira Service Desk team
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian status update as of 24th May 2018}
*Help us improve Jira Service Desk and Confluence linking in 3-minutes*

Thank you for your votes and comments on this suggestion. We want the good, bad and ugly about your experience with Confluence linking. It will take 3-minutes of your time to complete our short survey and your answers will help us better meet your needs.

[Take the survey|https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSckf5axTWCDE_FpDTcecUE_WD5UPeF9EZx8egDRU0Et1QW8bQ/viewform]

Thanks for being part of the journey.

Jira Service Desk team
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes there may be existing Confluence Spaces that already contain Knowledge Base data. Having the ability to link a single JIRA Service Desk to these spaces would be better, since that would require less Space and Page re-arranging. Not changing the pre-existing Knowledge Base environment would be less troubling for Customers as well.
h3. Suggested Solution

Have JIRA Service Desk be able to connect to multiple Confluence Spaces.

h3. Workaround 
Assuming the end goal is to have unlicensed access to multiple Confluence spaces, create dummy JIRA projects and link them to the desired Confluence spaces.
fields.summary: Multiple Confluence Knowledge Base spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Service Desk is not able to create the service-desk-agents group in crowd

h3. Environment
* Crowd 2.8.3
* Service Desk 2.5.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure JIRA with Crowd directory at the top (with read and write permissions).
# Crowd needs to have a delegated directory at the top on the application's directory list.
# The delegated directory should have all the permissions enabled.
# Log in as a user from Crowd and try to add a user as an agent from Add-ons, Service Desk Agents
    
h3. Expected Results
The agent is created without problems, since the Crowd directory is able to create the user and the group locally without edit the remote delegate directory.

h3. Actual Results
The following error is displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2016-01-15 at 11.54.16 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
# Create the "service-desk-agents" group in Crowd
# Run a SELECT in the cwd_group table to verify the group ID and directories ID
{code:SQL}SELECT id, directory_id FROM cwd_group WHERE group_name = 'service-desk-agents';{code}
# Add the Service Desk properties (synch.created.by.jira.service.desk) to this group directly in Crowd's database with the following INSERT statement replacing the IDs with the ones retrieved above
{code:SQL}INSERT INTO cwd_group_attribute VALUES (99999, <groupid>, <directoryID>, 'synch.created.by.jira.service.desk', 'synch.created.by.jira.service.desk', 'synch.created.by.jira.service.desk');{code}
# Synchronize the Crowd directory in JIRA

This is similar to the second workaround on this KB article: [Unable to add user to group error while creating a new Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+add+user+to+group+error+while+creating+a+new+Service+Desk]
fields.summary: Service Desk is not able to create the service-desk-agents group in crowd

  {panel}

h3. Problem
If there is an existing user with the same email address as the one set up as the email channel, the user will be added as the Request Participant for every request created from the email.
This is as outlined in [Adding request participants|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver033/adding-request-participants-861255383.html].
{quote}
If you create or respond to a request via email, add a request participant's email address in the TO or CC fields. The participant receives an email notifying them that they have been added.
{quote}

h3. Suggestion
Do not add the user who has the same email address as the one set up as the email channel as a Request Participant automatically

h3. Workaround
Disable the user in JIRA if the user account is not in use except for the email channel

{panel:title=Original description|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3}
This is similar to [JSD-2298|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-2298] but the scenario is creating a comment by replying to a notification email.

Scenario:
1. Reporter creates an issue via email. There is a customer user with the same email address as the one used by JSD to fetch emails.
2. Reporter receives a notification email from JSD.
3. Reporter replies to the notification email. This reply creates a comment.
4. The customer user with the same email address as the one used to fetch emails is added as a Request Participant.

Expected result: at step 4, do not add this user as a request participant. It is unnecessary. This user is no longer added as a request participant when the issue is first created via email, as per the issue noted above. I think the same handling should be applied when responding to email notifications.

I did raise this as a support issue, and was told the functionality is working as intended but that I could raise a feature request.
{panel}
fields.summary: Do not add customer with same email address as the one used to fetch emails as a request participant.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3267].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Users that do not have the JIRA Administrator Global Permission are able to make Permission Scheme changes.

# Login as a user with the JIRA Global Permission of at least JIRA Administrator or more.
# Modify the Service Desk Project Permission Scheme. In this case, we removed all users from having the Permission to Delete Issues. Some organizations have the requirement to NOT Delete any Issues in their Service Desk Project.
# Login as a User that DOES NOT have the JIRA Administrators Global Permission, but is a Service Desk Project Admin.
# This User will receive a Yellow and White Pop-up box that says: "This service desk project may not work as expected. View details and repair the problem"
# This User receives the "Permission scheme error" with the button "Upgrade Permission Scheme". The User that DOES NOT have the JIRA Administrator Global Permission clicks this button.
# The ability to Delete Issues has been _added back_ to the Permission Scheme.

h3. Suggested Solution
Only allow users that have been granted the JIRA Administrator Global Permission - just as it is in JIRA Core Projects - be able to modify Permission Schemes. No other users with lesser JIRA Global Permissions should have the ability to see the "Upgrade Permission Scheme" button, and be able to make changes to a Permission Scheme.
 
h3. Workaround 
Only have Project Admins that you want to be able to modify Permission Schemes be able to be Service Desk Project Admins. This is not the case with JIRA Core Projects. In JIRA Core Projects, you can have a Project Administrator NOT have to have the JIRA Administrator Global Permission. Those Project Admins do not have the ability to make changes to Permission Schemes. This should be the case with Service Desk as well.
fields.summary: Users without the proper Global Permissions should not be able to Upgrade the Permission Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When JIRA Service Desk evaluation license is expired but JIRA Software Commercial license is not expired , user can't create issue for JIRA Software project.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software v7.0.5
* JIRA Service Desk v3.0.5 or v3.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Software and use a working Commercial License for it.
# Get an evaluation JIRA Service Desk License.
# Change the system date to pass the Expiry date.
# Refresh JIRA and Re-login.
# Try to create issue.

 !Screen Shot 2016-02-06 at 3.24.47 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
As JIRA Software's license is still valid, users should be able to create issues without any problems.


h3. Actual Results
Users are not able to create any issues due to the expired Evaluation License for JIRA Service Desk

 !Screen Shot 2016-02-06 at 3.23.24 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
It will still work if it is a Commercial License that is expired, just like prior to JIRA 7

h3.Workaround
# Navigate to JIRA Administration > Applications > Versions & Licenses
# Remove the Expired License by clicking the "Trash" icon or update it with a valid license

 !Screen Shot 2016-02-06 at 3.26.12 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to Create Issue for JIRA Software project when Service Desk Evaluation License Expired

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3254].
  {panel}

At the moment, Open/Closed requests in the Customer Portal is determined by the Resolution.

If a request has a resolution, it will be in *Closed requests*. If it doesn't have a resolution, it will be in *Open requests*. The status of request will not matter.

In certain situations, it would be better if the Open/Closed requests will look at the Status of the request, instead of the resolution.

For example, an agent will propose a resolution for the request (by setting a resolution) but will still need confirmation from the user. Only when the user agrees and transition the request to Closed should the request be considered closed and appear in *Closed requests*
fields.summary: Resolved issues are visible in customer portal in 'Closed requests'

h3. Summary
JIRA Service Desk can't paste a new screenshot if it is a second attempt after canceling this first attempt attaching screenshot.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk 3.0.5


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Service Desk issue ticket
# Get a screenshots , for example for Windows user *Ctrl+PrintScreen*
# Then , press *Ctrl + V* to paste . A *Add Attachment* screens will pop up . Then , click *Cancle*
# At the same sessions , get another screenshots by pressing  *Ctrl+PrintScreen* . Then paste again . 
# There's no *Add Attachment* screens pop up.

h3. Expected Results
*Add Attachment* screens will pop up.

h3. Actual Results
*Add Attachment* screens doesn't pop up for the second attempt.
 
h3. Notes
I tested with JIRA Software project , and it works as expected. *Add Attachment* screens pop up for the second attempt.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk doesn't pop up "Add Attachment" screen for second attempt in the same sessions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3232].
  {panel}

h3. Summary:
There will be multiple WARN stack traces in the logs in regards of JIRA Service Desk Automation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce.
# Create two Service Desk Project, e.g. SD A and SD B.
# On "SD B" navigate to the _Project Administration > Automation_.
# Create a "Reopen on Customer Comment" rule and confirm.
# Run the following Query:
{code:sql}
select p.id,p.pname,pr."PROJECT_ID",rl."NAME",rl."DESCRIPTION",wh."MODULE_KEY" from "project" p 
right join "AO_9B2E3B_RSETREV_PROJ_CONTEXT" pr on (p.id = pr."PROJECT_ID")
join "AO_9B2E3B_RULESET_REVISION" rl on (pr."RULESET_REVISION_ID" = rl."RULE_SET_ID")
join "AO_9B2E3B_WHEN_HANDLER_CONFIG" wh on (rl."ID" = wh."ID");
{code}
# There will be a result for each project Automation Rule.
# Navigate to "SD B" project administration and delete the project.
# Create a Request in "SD A" and Resolved the ticket.
# As the Reporter, access the ticket in "Customer Portal" view and comment on the ticket.

h3. Expected Result:
* Nothing happen as there is no "Reopen on Customer Comment" rule in "SD A" without any stack trace in the logs.

h3. Actual Result:
* Nothing happen as well but there will be a WARN stack trace like below written in the logs.
{code}
2016-01-01 20:44:14,471 http-nio-8705-exec-4 WARN admin 1244x2604x1 1rreza0 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/customer/comment [c.a.s.p.a.i.e.whenhandler.event.AllEventListenerEventWhenHandlerVisitor] Event when handler execution of com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:servicedesk-commented-automation-rule-event-when-handler failed with error error.retrieving.project : 'error.retrieving.project'
2016-01-01 20:44:14,471 http-nio-8705-exec-4 WARN admin 1244x2604x1 1rreza0 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/customer/comment [c.a.s.p.a.i.e.whenhandler.event.AllEventListenerEventWhenHandlerVisitor] Event when handler execution of com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:servicedesk-commented-automation-rule-event-when-handler failed with error error.retrieving.project : 'error.retrieving.project'
2016-01-01 20:44:14,471 http-nio-8705-exec-4 WARN admin 1244x2604x1 1rreza0 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/customer/comment [c.a.s.p.a.i.e.whenhandler.event.AllEventListenerEventWhenHandlerVisitor] Event when handler execution of com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:servicedesk-commented-automation-rule-event-when-handler failed with error error.retrieving.project : 'error.retrieving.project'
{code}

h3. Notes:
* Run the same query below and there will be an automation rule that did not have any project specified as it is deleted:
{code:sql}
select p.id,p.pname,pr."PROJECT_ID",rl."NAME",rl."DESCRIPTION",wh."MODULE_KEY" from "project" p 
right join "AO_9B2E3B_RSETREV_PROJ_CONTEXT" pr on (p.id = pr."PROJECT_ID")
join "AO_9B2E3B_RULESET_REVISION" rl on (pr."RULESET_REVISION_ID" = rl."RULE_SET_ID")
join "AO_9B2E3B_WHEN_HANDLER_CONFIG" wh on (rl."ID" = wh."ID");
{code}
 !Screen Shot 2016-01-01 at 6.25.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 
* If we delete an existing Automation Rule while the Project is still exist, the row about that automation rule will still be exist.
* Tried to do the same for an Automation Rule that is deleted while the Project is still exist could not replicate the same stack trace to be thrown.
* This is WARN stack trace, it should not affect JIRA operations as it is a WARNING.
fields.summary: Automation throws 'error.retrieving.project' WARN stack traces in the logs.

In JIRA Service Desk Cloud. 

h3. Problem Definition

Currently site-admin count toward a licence seat for JSD. This is because in order to manage JSD a user has to have application access to JSD. 

h3. Suggested Solution

For a site-admin to have application access to JIRA Service Desk without counting toward a license count. This would allow a JIRA site-admin to have the ability to administer a JSD project and not have to pay additional licensing cost.  

h3. Workaround 
None at the moment. User must be able to access JSD in order to administer JSD projects.
fields.summary: Allow for JSD site-admin to manage the application without counting toward a license seat

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3225].
  {panel}

Please, can we allow removing Atlassian / Jira branding on the service desk portal (including the footer), like we are able to do with other commercially available cloud service desks.  Consistent branding across all of our tools is important to any organisation.

NB: This is not a duplicate of JSD-22 or JSD-982, which are requests for self-customisation of the templates. This request is not asking for custom HTML/CSS or branding customisation, this is request is purely to remove the existing Atlassian/Jira branding.

With this branding completely removed, we can then create our own branding wrap-around your the Atlassian service desk portal (by means of iframes or other means). 

Additionally, being able to remove the version of Jira/Service Desk is useful for security purposes.
fields.summary: Allow removing Alassian/Jira branding from Service Desk

h5. Problem definition
Currently when an e-mail has more than 255 characters on the mail field, it will not be processed by JIRA Service Desk mail channel. No error is thrown to the original sender and message is not processed. 
On a regular JIRA mail handler, the e-mail will be truncated and processed, although.

h5. Suggestion
Allow processing more than 255 characters or, at least, notify the original sender when the e-mail is not processed.
fields.summary: Allow processing of e-mail that have more than 255 characters on subject
